website_summaries.verdict: High-quality components combined with exceptionally sturdy construction remind you why Behringer is a leader in the audio industry.
pros: Clear audio with boosted signal housed in a compact, yet very attractive, heavy-duty steel casing
It does have a power light, but it is a less-intrusive amber light than comparable models
cons: Included power adapter is not the best quality
Some customers have experienced intermittent clipping caused by voltage spikes

customer_reviews.title: Good price/performace. Killer deal for RIAA turntable preamp.
customer_reviews.text: Lot of bang for the buck. I've heard that these do not have good longevity if moved all over hells acre; however, stuck behind my shelving unit and powering the sounds from my old Pioneer turntable, it does a great job. You'd have to go at least 2x the cost and old retro on ebay to find the next worthwhile bump in performance, or else go for a new $100+ model. Are there better? Yeah. But at this price performance, unless you've sunk a ton into the rest of the system, this won't be the weakest link.
customer_reviews.author: slightlyevolved

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-amp!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a converter for my record player to be able to play music through my Pioneer amp, and this was a perfect pre-amp! Easy to set-up, and the sound is very clear and crisp! Update: I have been using the pre amp for a long while, and there has been no issues with sound quality, or anything regarding my vinyl record set-up. I have suggested the BEHRINGER Microphono PP400 pre amp for many of my friends that have started delving into the vinyl record addiction that I have spread.
customer_reviews.author: Jack H

customer_reviews.title: Amplified Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Watch my video review here for a closer look! I recently upgraded turntables so I wanted to also upgrade my pre-amp. I decided to try the Behringer pre-amp mainly because of its size and price. It is a pretty simple design and easy to set up with your audio system. Sound quality is very good. It is definitely louder than my older pre-amp, but does not compromise the sound quality. Just what I needed! Pros: - Affordable - Simple design - Easy to set up - Small, lightweight. Easy to hide behind a turntable. - Great sound quality, good volume - Includes ground connection - Additional 1/4" output connection - Handy On LED light indicator Cons: - None
customer_reviews.author: debaserphoto

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to upgrade my Fluance RT-81
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap upgrade to the built in pre-amp for my Fluance RT-81. After listening for a couple of weeks I found the built in pre amp to be lacking, specifically in the mid range. Things just sounded harsh and mashed up. This unit definitely improved the quality of the sound. I use this in conjunction with some upgraded a/v cables.
customer_reviews.author: Homer S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Pre-Amp
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. A lower end, lower priced pre-amp. While doing research for a pre-amp, I discovered that they vary in price, and I assume quality and performance, from &10.00 up to a $1,000. 00. While I have a fair substantial vinyl collection, it has not always been maintain properly form traveling worldwide to lack of knowledge in maintaining vinyl so I could not justify a large cash purchase at the time. At some point I may replace with a better performing pre-amp sure as a tube version. Hat being said, I can't fault this pre-amp. I don't notice any humming or other undo noise. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Been working great for almost a year now.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds pretty good! I’m not a purist but this seems to produce a warm natural tone comparable to my old Harmon Kardon receiver from the early 80’s (I still have it and did compare them). Others have reported thumps when they plug this in, I never shut it off. I leave it behind my turntable and it just does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Loscheider

customer_reviews.title: Perfect basic preamp
customer_reviews.text: Does the job perfectly. I recently bought new Kanto speakers and have been using an older Sony amplifier that I got from a friend when I first got interested in records. Sadly the Sony amplifier couldn't work with the speakers so I decided to get a basic pre amp. This item is significantly smaller then the Sony amplifier I was using so now I have tons of space and this item does the same exact job as the larger amplifier. I am extremely happy with this item and would definitely purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Russell F. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: The amp is awesome but lacks a phono input
customer_reviews.text: I had replaced my old amp/receiver with a new Yamaha RX-V675. The amp is awesome but lacks a phono input. I decided on the Behringer PP400 mostly because I'm familiar with Behringer audio gear. A lot of Ham Radio operators(yes, I'm a Ham) like the Behringer line of products so I thought I'd give it a try. I very pleased with the product. It correctly applies the RIAA equalization curve and brings the level up to line level. I have absolutely no HUM from this device. I did properly ground the unit to my system ground. Highly recommended for a low-cost phono preamp that works well and is will made.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marchuk

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little phono preamp!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet little phono preamp! Good quality connectors and solid construction. The sound produced is well balanced and full of depth, with plenty of presence and definition in highs, lows, and mids. I think this phono stage represents a great value, competing well with much higher priced audiophile grade equipment. I have it paired with a vintage Technics SL-J2 turntable, amplified by an Integra AVR driving FOCAL speakers. It truly sounds impressive, especially for the money. Highly recommended buy. And, 3 year warranty ... I plan to use the 1/4" line out to archive vinyl, which is a useful feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: ransur0t

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I have a lower end older turntable that ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have a lower end older turntable that I had to hook up to a newer receiver. None of the units are what folks might call audiophile quality but it's working out ok for me so far. I notice it's a pretty weak gain though. I don't know if that's the proper term but in plain talk, I have to turn up the receiver more with this combination. --- Not a deal breaker by any means though.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Started with this unit before moving onto something better. Totally works as advertised - but the stage ...
customer_reviews.text: No hum on my end (at-lp120 and NAD D 3020). Started with this unit before moving onto something better. Totally works as advertised - but the stage seems dead or muddled. Definitely not lacking in warmth for being so cheap. Just not very dynamic. Great starter preamp to pickup and then test against more expensive units in the future. This should be the entry baseline for anyone getting back into turntables.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperX

customer_reviews.title: Did not solve the issue.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, it never worked properly. I ordered it for my brother who bought a new receiver while I was visiting him in New Jersey (Amazon also sent 1 to my home in Chicago, but I returned that one when I got back home). His new receiver didn’t have a phono jack, and we hoped this would solve it. Sadly, it either worked like the non-preamp situation or hummed over the speakers. He just returned the reciever & bought one with a phono jack. The problem may have been with his phonograph, but he decided to keep the preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Legaré Porcher

customer_reviews.title: Everyone was happy. Highly suggested if your receiver doesn't have a ...
customer_reviews.text: My father in law's receiver didn't have a phono input for him to play his vinyl collection. He couldn't figure out why he could barely hear his records when he had the player plugged into the CD input or any other one. I bought this for him and "installed" it (installing consist of plugging it in basically). Everyone was happy. Highly suggested if your receiver doesn't have a phone input and you want to listen to your record collection.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Alford

customer_reviews.title: Can listen to my records again.
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted to play my records again, and with this little wonder, now I can. My receiver, (which is a surround sound receiver), because of the new technology now, isn't capable of playing records. With this, now I can listen to them again. All you do is plug in one end of an RCA cable, (red is right, white is left) to the back of this, and then the other end of the RCA cable an empty audio space on your receiver,and do the same thing with another RCA cable. Very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good preamp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a preamp for my Rega Planar 2 turntable with my Pioneer VSX-1122 receiver and it's worked great to boost the volume to appropriate levels. I've been using it for about a year and a half never noticed any hum. I consider myself a little bit of an audiophile without the financial means to actually buy the really high-quality stuff and I regularly try to find a good deal to upgrade a piece of equipment, but I've never looked to replace this preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Decent RIAA Phono Preamp - awful power supply
customer_reviews.text: The preamp is OK. It's got an audible noise floor, but that'll be swamped by LP surface noise. The real problem is the 12vdc switching power supply. It's cycling at 1-3Hz and that 1-to-3 Hz signal is getting recorded by my recording interface. It shows up as the meters flickering at the bottom every few seconds. This makes it really difficult to use automated LP record-and-rip tools for this purpose. Replacing the power supply with something that works properly will fix this problem. The jimmiedave site has a lot more detail.
customer_reviews.author: David Cain

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to use a turntable without a separate amp or receiver
customer_reviews.text: This works great for what I needed, which is a small compact setup for my office with just an old pioneer turntable and a set of powered speakers. I did not want to use a separate receiver. Once I hooked everything up properly there is no buzzing and the speakers that I paired them with sound amazing.
customer_reviews.author: 84Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Surprising product
customer_reviews.text: I had a little doubt whether it would actually work with my Onkyo receiver which doesn't have phone input. But what a surprise. It's a small unit but as soon as I connect it to my receiver according to the instruction in the manual, it worked like a charm. It's cheap but it doesn't look cheap at all. I could see it's solidly built and worked as it promised. Don't spend more than $50 on the similar item that basically does the same thing. You will be pleasantly surprised too.
customer_reviews.author: April Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Since Sliced Bread!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to buy those USB turntable that are now available, because I have a nice high quality turntable that doesn't harm my record collection. I used this device to connect my turntable directly to my Mac which enables me to directly convert my albums to digital. I've even tested it on both Windows and Linux computers and it still works, flawlessly. An awesome device, it doesn't color the sound or introduce new noise into the signal. Simple to hook up. So if you still have a working turntable and you have albums that you would like to convert to digital, then device is for you.
customer_reviews.author: GuitarPlaya

customer_reviews.title: Behringer PP400 Preamp Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a "brand new, out of the box" 30year old Technics SL-BD27 but I needed a preamp to make it work on my new receiver. When it arrived it took maybe 3 minutes to connect it up and make music. This is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget, it does the job just right
customer_reviews.text: Connecting an analog record player (with a moving magnet cartridge) to a computer cannot be done without a proper pre-amp. This device gives you a nice line out signal, plus it seems that somehow reduces the surface noise found on almost any used vintage LP. I am not so much into theory about RIAA equalization, I mostly trust my ears and I like what I hear. I am totally satisfied with this product and I would recommend it to anyone, novice or pro. But, remember, the sound can always be tweaked by using some sort of editing software. Dumping a LP onto computer is just a part of otherwise fairly complex process of digitizing your vinyl collection.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bugarchich

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: This preamp is solid, especially considering the low price. It's performance will not knock your socks off by any means, but if you don't have a super high performance stereo, it's not really going to matter. Upgrading other components of your stereo system, like speakers, amp, TT, etc., makes sense before upgrading your preamp, in terms of value/dollar. My main beef is that I lost the power supply to this guy (let my sister borrow it for a DJing gig). I couldn't find a replacement, so I ended up buying an entirely new unit. I guess I now have an insurance policy if this thing craps out... it is, after all, a $20 unit...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lumberton

customer_reviews.title: amazing little box!
customer_reviews.text: I have always owned a turntable, I have an ebay vinyl record store and am a dj. I digitize everything I sell to archive as mp3's. Grew up totally analog so I always kept a DJ mixer as a phono preamp. I really wanted to streamline my system and space so I purchased this little gizmo to see if the quality would be the same as my GLI 9000 or Gemini DJ mixer. No difference is sound quality, it takes up allot less space, I assume it uses less energy as well. I am a Behringer fan, I have their audio mixers. I am very pleased with this unit, as well as Amazons shipping speed and packaging. Lovely!
customer_reviews.author: The Queen of Healthy Latin Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing, Static, Shorting Out Playback
customer_reviews.text: I am running from my Technics SL-Q2 turntable, to this preamp, then into my PS Audio Sprout amp. Upon initially hooking up and turning on, the signal was waaay boosted, but nothing but buzzing, static-y, shorting out play back—just very loud. Am I missing something?? Is there an issue because the Sprout already has a preamp? I was just looking for a little boost. Please help!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got a record player at the thrift shop and found out when I brought it home that if your stereo doesn't have a "Phono" input even at max volume it was very quiet. Did a google search and discovered I needed a Phono Preamp. This Preamp is small enough to hide behind my home theater to which I have my turntable plugged into. I love the fact that this preamp has a ground spot. Absolutely no buzzing sound. I still have to have the volume turned up a little higher than I would if I were listening to MP3's but it does it's job very well, I can still shake the walls.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Roller

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Set-up: u-Turn Orbit turntable -> Behringer PP400 -> Lepai LP-2020+ -> Dayton B652 I admit that I have no experience with other pre-amps so if you're looking for comparisons to other pre-amps then this review isn't for you. I am using this as a vinyl novice and am very satisfied with it even if solely for that fact that it's cheap and works. I can't comment on how clean it is as I've never heard it through other systems either. This is simply a working pre-amp that will get vinyl newbies into the game rather cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Highly Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: The phono preamp on my stereo receiver started acting up this year. This inexpensive product sounds just as good, and allows me to use any of the line level audio inputs instead. I have no connections to Behringer other than being a satisfied customer. I'm quite pleased with the quality and craftsmanship of their products. They've worked very well, and usually at a significant savings over the competition.
customer_reviews.author: ScottChi in NC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This products now makes my old turntable run with a newer receiver . Easy instructions and setup. However there is no on/off switch and I had to by a wall on/off switch, minor problem but keeps it at a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Sands

customer_reviews.title: Not the first Behringer product I have purchased.
customer_reviews.text: But the preamp is not as good as the compander or mixer I purchased. The output is a bit muddy when run through a clean channel on the mixer. When the phono is run through a receiver with a phono input the range is quite noticeably cleaner than when it is run through the preamp into the mixer. Mic and mp3 player are clean in the same channel so it seems to be in the preamp. I will dig into the preamp and see what the cause may be but it works well enough on hip-hop to be worth the purchase. Just doesn't work cleanly on rock or classical music.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Beck

customer_reviews.title: Noiseless, high quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe my ears when begun using this. My 1984 sony turntable was broken for several years, and after repairing it, I needed a phono preamp. I tried this and I can't believe the crystal clear sound out of the whole system. Completely noiseless, with or without an LP playing. I can highly recommend this phono preamp. I couldn't be more happy with it. Note: I'm not using the ground screw as my turntable doesn't have a ground out. You should not use it unless you got that in your turntable.
customer_reviews.author: Fito

customer_reviews.title: What's old is new again
customer_reviews.text: Adding an old turntable that I had to my sound system was the project. This was the bridge needed to make that happen.
customer_reviews.author: Solojourney

customer_reviews.title: Quality built and sound quality was good.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should. Quality built and sound quality was good. I gave it to my little brother along with my extra Technics turntable when his turntable died. He's had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hinze

customer_reviews.title: spin the vinyl
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased a new receiver and not noticing it had no phono out.. this saved me! Works fine. Revise this to 1 star only worked a few months, now notta just a piece of wasted metal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So you bought that really good belt drive turntable, with the $150 stylis, and now you realize that your do not have dedicated phono jack, (which contains the pre-amp), and the turntable is so good it does not have one built in. do you really have to spend $100 - $200 for a pre-amp? NO! This is a great product, the price is right, no hum or hiss. The phonograph sounds great, and the signal is clean and clear. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fredstrong

customer_reviews.title: this unit is great. Does exactly what I should but compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this unit is great. Does exactly what I should but compared to my old one it was a huge upgrade. For modern receivers with no phono input, this is a great option for a few bucks. I bet you need to spend tons more to achieve better sound than this and mine is part of a pretty decent system in the $3000 range.
customer_reviews.author: RichP

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive preamp really took my vinyl game to the next level. The record player I bought (Pro-Ject Debut Carbon) came with a cheap, terrible preamp that incessantly buzzed at a very low frequency. I hemmed and hawed and delayed upgrading because I thought I would have to shell out a ton of money. Finally, I just pulled the trigger on this one on a whim, and really couldn't be happier. They low-end buzz is gone completely, and this thing just sounds great. If you can't spend the big bucks on a fancy preamp but want your records to sound good, there's no reason to not buy this preamp.
customer_reviews.author: Will Leemkuil

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent pre-amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pre-amp for the price. Rich sound and good frequency response. I've had it is operation for two months now with no issues. I use it with my Audio-Technica LP--120 turntable and I can say the Behringer sounds much better than the built-in pre-amp.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Boman

customer_reviews.title: Great Price. Works Fine.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should. Maybe not as well as some other really expensive units out there, but if all you really want is to be able to hook up your turntable to your old power amp... this works just fine. Bear in mind that it's not this giving you issue if you hear hum coming from your speakers. It means that your turntable is too close to your amp. Separate them as much as possbile and you'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Footnote Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to hook up my record player to my soundbar! UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to hook up my old turntable to my soundbar on my TV! The device is small, straightforward, and lightweight - I mounted it on the back of the cabinet the record player sits on. One input, one output, and one power cable. No adjustments to be made - it just works. I'm so happy to finally be listening to records out in the living room! Edit - 1 year later and it's still working perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! Finally listening to my 100s of vinyl :)
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. I asked a friend if the whole hookup was possible, and he recommended this product. I have a 1977-ish Technics record player offically hooked up to my 2009-2010 Samsung SmarTV. I did have some humming at the beginning but noticed that the little gold fixture was for the ground wire... plugged it in, humming gone!! I can't believe how easy it was to hook this up and make it happen!! AND all at $20!! I'm one happy lady with this product. Recommend, recommend, recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: jesmitty4

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly was it says.
customer_reviews.text: Had to hook an old 1970s phono from the old tuner (that went bad recently) to the new surround sound system. Couldn't get it to output sound at first but once i plugged a 1/4 jack in then out it worked fine and has since (my guess it was thinking it had headphones plugged in and wasn't outputting to rca jacks). MAKE SURE TO CONNECT THE GROUND CABLE!!! Sound quality was great even on max volume on my receiver. Definitely better option then buying a whole new turntable.
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: No frills, no hassle
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this to power an old school Technics 220 turntable through my mixer and Mackie monitors. It's a no frills, boring piece, but it's functional, and sounds completely fine to me. No extra distortion or anything like that. Just plug it in, hook up your ground, and you're fully incorporated into the hipster club. You can tell all your friends about how you always prefer the vinyl sound, and that despite its inconvenience, it's the only way to listen to the Velvet Underground. And really, what else is life about?
customer_reviews.author: mhall

customer_reviews.title: Great little Phono PreAmp.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go with my Sony PS-LX4 turntable. They work well together and the sound is amazing with my 5.1 surround sound receiver. Pros. Small and Low power. (only 150mA) Con. The sound output is still a little quiet vs other sources on the receiver. Wishes. I wish this had a power switch so I could turn it off while I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the casual listener, audiophiles beware.
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level device for getting those old records spinning again. The only issue with this device is if this source is active on your receiver, and you plug the device in it gives a VERY loud POP and may even trigger the safety on your receiver. It's not a huge drawback, just remember to have the device powered up before you listen. I have experienced no hum, no feedback or issues at all. Headphone output is at maximum volume, which may be too loud and cannot be controlled unless connected to another device.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Miller

customer_reviews.title: A great preamp for a small price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little preamp for a small price. With the newer amplifiers you need a preamp since the systems don't have a preamp circuit built in any longer. Great packaging, has an AC power supply and it works great for a small price. Installed one years ago for my father-in-law and it is still working without hum or any other annoyance. I just got this as a Christmas gift so that I could use my turntable with the new tuner amplifier system.
customer_reviews.author: Beardedone

customer_reviews.title: easy hook up
customer_reviews.text: This might not be a fair rating. Just purchased this for my new Denon 2300 receiver, easy hook up, connect to CD output on receiver, got no sound, tried everything, nothing seems to work. Any suggestions here. I need to revise this review. This was my issue. New receiver and I was not familiar with inputs. Needed to change CD input to analog. Works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Casillo

customer_reviews.title: Compact, very affordable, small and simple
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people I replaced my old stereo amp with a complete home theater system and discovered that I needed an amp for the turntable. I tried using an old stand-alone amp/ receiver that worked, but caused a distinctive loud hum. This compact Preamp is the real deal. Easy to set up, small enough to hide behind other system components and it completely eliminated the hum.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what to say other than go with another option. After I was so disappointed I took it apart to see what it was made of and it is the most pathetic circuit. If you dont want to spend a lot, buy a preamp board off Ebay and make it one. It's not hard at all. Or spend more and get something else. This wont do the job
customer_reviews.author: Archetyp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pre-amp for my pre-ampless receiver
customer_reviews.text: My Pioneer Elite VSX-53 receive has every bell and whistle...except a phono pre-amp -_- Bought this to go along with a vintage JVC record player I picked up for $25 bucks. Works great and is very small, so easy to hide out of the way. I forget I have it sometimes until I look behind my equipment rack to do something. I'm a stickler for conserving power, so I was kind of worried about it staying on all the time, but it seems to barely draw any power at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended !! Warm, transparent & quiet !!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new preamp for my old Dual 606 turntable and decided to take a chance on this very inexpensive Behringer and could not be more pleased . I'm using this to transfer vinyl directly to an Alesis Masterlink, and the sound is magnificent. Cannot comment on it's longevity, as I've only been using it for a short time; but , as a long time audio professional who has often been disappointed by the reproduction I was getting from my vinyl records, I am thoroughly delighted in every way with the PP400.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES L HALL

customer_reviews.title: Behringer PP400 Phono Preamp
customer_reviews.text: Easy plug and play design. Ran the cables from my JVC record player to the inputs on the Preamp and then ran cables out from the Preamp to my Marantz cassette component which in turn runs to my Accurian 5.1 surround receiver. Accurian Sub-woofer, RCA front and rear speakers. It's a mutt system but it all works great together! Didn't even need to run a ground wire, no hum noticed. Good price and fast shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. When I first plugged it in, I had a lot of hum. After I fixed it, it sounds perfect. MAKE SURE YOU GET DECENT RCA CABLES!!!!! I was using the little skinny ones that you probably have at home, but the RCA cable you use between the turntable and this is important. Get some good thick shielded ones (they sell em on amazon for <$10) or you will have hum/static issues.
customer_reviews.author: Royi H.

customer_reviews.title: older vinyl players need one to boost signal to newer receivers.
customer_reviews.text: good for the average audiophiles. price a little high for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Iotme411

customer_reviews.title: Behringer PP400 - works well!
customer_reviews.text: Preformes as advertised. Did not have grounding wire on phono. Have not grounded and works w/out any hum or other problem. I suspect that since outlets are keyed - can only plug in one way - it properly grounds circuit. I did follow another reviewers advice and used 3' rca. Reviewer suggested to use a short rca to reduce chance of audio issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Huchthausen

customer_reviews.title: Let the LP's be heard!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my turn table which is connected to my Sony receiver through this pre-amp. I have to say this is a very good pre-amp for the money. It was recommended by a friend and I'm glad I listened. If I listen to a bad LP I hear minimum distortion compared to when I had no pre-amp at all. If you don't have the funds to spend hundreds of $$ on your equipment this little guy will do the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperMe

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Sound quality excellent. Now my Dual 504 turntable is rejuvenated!
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, very affordable, and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the fact that this product is made of metal instead of chincey plastic like so many other small stereo accessories these days. But above all, the product does exactly what it's supposed to, it was very affordable, and simple to use. I hooked up my record player and was enjoying crystal clear music within minutes. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: GreenMonstah

customer_reviews.title: Good for a budget setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter's first turntable, a midline 80's Kenwood. Not a bad match, it has plenty of gain for the P-mount A-T moving magnet cartridge, it's silent, and sounds OK. Nice that it comes in an indestructible metal case with a ground-wire connection too. Behringer stuff is always about this good and seems excellent when you weigh price/performance!
customer_reviews.author: MisterBearBaby

customer_reviews.title: it does seem like I have to have my stereo a bit louder ...
customer_reviews.text: Works, it does seem like I have to have my stereo a bit louder than normal, but I always play my music loud. I do hear a little buzz, but also have it resting on a metal cabinet and if I put something underneath it, it does quiet the buzzing a bit. Like I said, I do listen to my albums with the volume up, if I turn it down, the buzzing is almost non-existent
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what is is supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: East to hook up, and it fixed my sound issue. What else can I say? Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kestrel068

customer_reviews.title: Works Great....Just Ground it properly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get back in to spinning vinyl on my old turn table and my 7.1 surround sound receiver didn't have a phone input so audio was low with out a pre-amp. the PP400 did have a hum at first however that was only because I didn't ground it to the turn table. Once Grounding was taken care of it worked great. It sounds good. It was the best pre-amp at an affordable price. I really like it. I doesn't have USB but I plan to hook it into a USB audio mixer anyways when I record to the computer. I would recommend this to anyone. It's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: holy joe 7

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. No hint of the hum or hiss others have described, whether turntable was grounded or not. Seems to provide a very clean, clear signal. Very simple and straightforward connections, clearly marked. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because it would be nice to have some sort of power switch. Once plugged in, it's "on" all the time. Well worth the very reasonable price, and I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Just works!
customer_reviews.text: Who says you need expensive equipment? I used to be into all that until I realized that I spent way too much money for no reason. So I completely downgraded. My setup now is my old turntable, this preamp, and a pair of Logitech computer speakers. Sounds awesome for a fraction of the price. Never buying mid or high end equipment again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Chitoiu

customer_reviews.title: You can still listen to the old vinyl...
customer_reviews.text: Who knew I could use my 30+ year old turntable with my Bose. Such a simple solution and 100% worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie K

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Low Signal Issues
customer_reviews.text: Totally fixed my phono signal. The price and quality of this product are good as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nubel

customer_reviews.title: Behringer PP400 Phono Preamp
customer_reviews.text: Great choice for entry level audiophile who wants the most bang for the buck. I attached the ground wire from my Technics SL-7 Direct Drive Turntable (applies only to those with moving magnet cartridges) to the PP400 Preamp to preclude hum. Then connect RCA Output jacks on Preamp directly to an otherwise unused AV Receiver Input such as Tape, CD, MD, Game or Aux (applies to AVRs without a Phono input). The result is audibly hum free, clean sounding RIAA correted Phono playback at approximately the same volume as other line inputs. My Vinal collection of recently "washed" Classical, Jazz and Rock has never sounded better. The Ultra-Compact size, quality construction, clean electronics and affordable price ($27.50) have me sold!
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Had an old 70's phongraph amp fail. This gadget let me hook up an inexpensive new sony turntable to a spare set of computer speakers, and now we can listen to our old records again. The quality seems fine to me, though I'm not listening to the scratchy old vinyl for the extreme audio quality anyway.
customer_reviews.author: cjlindem

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not so good. Very heavy on the mids.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is not so good. Very heavy on the mids.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt KC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I just love it when something arrives that works flawlessly. Such is the case with this little beauty. I just bought a Panasonic SPCTX7 home theater and thought for sure there was no way it would get along with my Bang and Olufsen circa 80s record player. Bought it on a whim. Its nothing short of miraculous. Just plugged the thing in 20 min ago, and working like a charm. No static. Crystal clear!!! Dont hesitate to buy~!!!
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: good overall quality
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced, good overall quality, if you need a phono output amplifier for your turn table. Hv been using it for a couple of years now, still satisfied with the sound. Will make an upgrade only if I can afford a good audiophile phono amp. For the time being, this will do.
customer_reviews.author: AuQ3 black bolt

customer_reviews.title: Works as sescribed
customer_reviews.text: This microphone was ordered for my mother who likes to record mp3s of herself and others. It works great for that and I have heard no issues.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: sweet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used high quality turntable with some birthday money. however, as an audio novice, I didn't realize it needed a preamp until I plugged it into my speakers and realized it hardly made any noise at all. so i looked online and found this great little piece of equipment. not only is it inexpensive, but it works great and retains excellent sound quality. it's also really easy to use. recommended for all.
customer_reviews.author: Slothflyer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of amplification, but for the price it does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lee

customer_reviews.title: I am sure there are better ones out there and I am not sure how ...
customer_reviews.text: I am sure there are better ones out there and I am not sure how long it will last, but this gives be better sound quality than I was getting with the built-in pre amp on my Audio Technica AT LP-60.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Brought out the best sound from my turntable
customer_reviews.text: Great small size product and makes the phono sound like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Alec G.

customer_reviews.title: Audiophiles will probably look elsewhere. Regular folks with a turntable, look no further.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a phono preamp since I wanted to get a new receiver, and naturally nothing has a phono input anymore. Couldn't believe it when I saw how cheap this thing was, but that's Behringer for you - and like other Behringer products, it's a tremendous bargain. It's been running for a month or so now without a hitch, gets me plenty of volume, and an authentic, warm sound. Even better than the built-in phono on my old receiver. I'm sure audiophiles can pick this thing apart but I've got a good ear and it sounds perfect to me. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Marra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I think this preamp is great. I have a receiver without a phono input and because of this, I was unable to hook up my turntable for the first time in years and it sounds great to me. I am no audiophile nor do I have a high end system, but for my normal receiver and system, this has worked out great and for a great price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Slu

customer_reviews.title: but I guess at the $34 price I paid all you can do is hope you get a good one. On the plus side the one channel ...
customer_reviews.text: One channel was muffled and intermittent, then it just died completely. Lack of any quality control, but I guess at the $34 price I paid all you can do is hope you get a good one. On the plus side the one channel that did work didn't sound too bad!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great for upgrading recivers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy for the price! My mom had an old receiver with phono inputs (built in preamp) on it and was very disappointed when most modern receivers do not have this. I set this up for her and it works great! No hiss, sounds as good as if not better than the old receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Real_name_goes_here

customer_reviews.title: OK record player preamp.
customer_reviews.text: The amplifier works ok, BUT I had to replace its power supply in short order. This boosts old magnetic head record players up to line-level, same as that of CD players, computers, keyboards, DVD players, CD players, and tape players.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Nozum

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly. I have my turntable hooked into my surround sound system now and it sounds great. No buzzing, no static. Behringer's products are above average quality for below average price. I have a lot of their stuff and it is always a great value.
customer_reviews.author: danTE_Undefined

customer_reviews.title: The sound is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This pre-amp does the job and does it well. I like the small size and the ease of use. The sound is GREAT! I have it attached to a classic DUAL record player and I couldn't be happier. I have had it hooked up for about 2 weeks so I cannot comment on long life but if it continues to perform this way I'm sure Ill stay happy for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Preamp for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this preamp for a Technics M5G turntable that I connect to a VCI-300. The VCI-300 has no preamp for the auxiliary input so this was necessary. For the price, this thing works great. It does exactly what I wanted it to do. Other reviews mention a hum sound and I definitely hear it. However, I use my turntable just for scratching so the hum isn't an issue for me and the preamp was only 20 bucks. I really wish it had an on/off switch, you need to unplug it to turn it off. Price and preamp = 5 stars Hum and lack of on/off switch = minus 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Chex

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding !!
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant about ordering this Preamp after reading a few reviews/ complaints concerning low frequency hum. After making my decision; I placed the order. This Preamp performs flawlessly. I have it connected to the video 2 input on my Onkyo 7.1 receiver. Hum is only audible at Max volume. And it's only heard without the vinyl playing. Who listens to music at Max volume? LOL!! If you did you would only hear the hum between tracks, that is, if you knew what you were listening for. This is a great Preamp don't waste money on a higher priced one. Your vinyl will sound tremendous. Thanks amazon for a great product ! CODEMED
customer_reviews.author: codemed

customer_reviews.title: Great pre-amp
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Pre-amp for a year and it has been great. After I figured out that you have to attach a ground cable to the record player it installed very easily just plug it in and it plays! I have not noticed any excess heat or other problems even though I keep it inside of my closed entertainment stand.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for those with receivers lacking a phono input
customer_reviews.text: For the last couple months my last pre-amp was experiencing an immense amount of hum/static that no amount of grounding or cables could fix. Gave up on self repair and found this well reviewed product. Hooked up to the record player and it was whisper quiet (which was a welcome change) and my records sound great now. Also it gets points for having the grounding input simply be a knob instead of a screw and when you're swimming in cables this is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: kidalive25

customer_reviews.title: boy was I glad I took the chance on this one
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous to buy because its Behringer and at the price point i thought i would get noise through the speakers, boy was I glad I took the chance on this one! It makes my records sound great paired with my Shure M97x on my good ol' BSR Table. Nice EQ and sound all around!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Freeman

customer_reviews.title: This preamp got us going and she now understands what I mean when I say she sounds like a stuck record
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter found my old collection of records and i dug out my ancient turntable but the new receiver did not have phono inputs. This preamp got us going and she now understands what I mean when I say she sounds like a stuck record :-)
customer_reviews.author: Unmesh Agarwala

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, very compact, and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I used it to connect a vintage Pioneer player to a high-end audio system, and the record player--not the Behringer preamp is the weak link. Unless you have great components from the record player all the way through to the speakers, there is no need to spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: This thing saved me
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty annoyed that I couldn't hook up my Technics turntable to my new Onkyo A/V receiver (which, unlike many receivers, doesn't have a pre-amp built in). This solved my problem quite cheaply and elegantly, and it sounds great; no mains hum or other noise. Plus, it's so small it can hide behind my receiver altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Eoban Binder

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' good Preamp
customer_reviews.text: I bought a sweet NAD receiver only to realize it had no phono input. My buddy Hugh from Human Solutions (a hardcore audiophile and all-around good guy) recommended the Behringer PP400 and he was spot on with his recommendation. It's easy to hook up (plug in the power, hook up the turntable rca cable and ground wire, and connect the preamp to your receiver) and the sound quality is great. Following the lead of my friend Hugh, I highly recommend this phono preamp. Happy vinyl listening awaits you.
customer_reviews.author: Baron von Housh

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up my old turntable to a modern amp and then realized I needed a preamp. This one was so reasonably priced, I decided to try it. Works just the way it should. Records sound clearer than they used to with the old amp setup so I believe this preamp has a positive effect.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D

customer_reviews.title: Been good for me with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Been good for me with no issues. I have had this for a couple years now and gets the job done, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan VanHorn

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Finally able to connect old phonograph to Bose system to hear my old vinyls. Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Diane McC

customer_reviews.title: Breat sound
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. The sound from my turn table is better than before.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin L. Suthers

customer_reviews.title: Hummer
customer_reviews.text: There is definitely a hum if turned up very loud, but otherwise not noticeable at lower volumes. This is a cheap fix but if you care about sound save up and buy something with a tube.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Bourland

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: The phono stage went down on my Dynaco preamp the other day. I am a vinyl nut and I love my records. I am in the middle of building a tube phono preamp but it is not ready to put in to service, so I needed something quick and cheap to allow me to play my records.This little preamp is alright. Rock and most Jazz sounds pretty good but with classical and piano it lacks detail in the middrange and highs but what do you expect for less than $30.00.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but careful how you ground it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a linear pre-amp that will bring the signal from a magnetic phonograph cartridge up to a level that can bu plugged into the AUX input of your receiver. I have no problem with hum unless I grounded the turn table to the amplifier. Another review complained about the power supply and I suspect it was a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Behringer PP400 Ultra-Compact Phono Preamp
customer_reviews.text: A FRIEND OF MINE GAVE ME A TURN TABLE THAT HE DID NOT NEED. I COULDN'T GET IT TO WORK . I CALLED LYNN THE LADY THAT HAS WORKED ON MY ELECTRONICS FOR YEARS { my guitar effects pedals to my tv's} AT A-1 T.V. IN POMONA CA. LYNN SAID I NEEDED A PHONO PRE AMP SO I LOOKED ON LINE AND FOUND THE Behringer PP400 Ultra-Compact Phono Preamp. IT IS EVERY THING I NEEDED IT TO BE. I HAVE USED BEHRINGER PRODUCTS BEFORE. THEY WORK GOOD. THANKS AMAZON. YOUR SERVICE IS FANTASTIC. """DINO DUPREE"""
customer_reviews.author: DINO

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pre-amp, worth it's weight
customer_reviews.text: Small, Runs cool (good), above average power supply!. Clean, Clean signal to run some old vinyl through. A little 'thick' sounding, but nothing to be afraid of. Strong output jacks, but the ground/ and it's position is horrid. It's 20 bucks +++ To anyone like me on a budget, just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: BetaBeard123

product_meta.title: Behringer Microphono PP400 Ultra-Compact Phono Preamp,Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

BEHRINGER MICROPHONO PP400 
Ultra-Compact Phono Preamp 

 * Converts your phono signal to a line level signal
 * State-of-the-art phono preamp to accommodate all magnetic pickups
 * Dedicated RCA and 1/4" TRS output connectors
 * DC 12 V adapter included
 * High-quality components and exceptionally rugged construction ensure long life
 * Conceived and designed by BEHRINGER Germany

In the age of the MP3, it can be easy to forget that a turntable signal needs a little help before it reaches a mixer or home stereo if it's going to be heard. Thanks to the PP400 phono preamp, your turntable will get the boost it needs to bring your vinyl to life.

VIVA VINYL
The ultra-compact PP400 features stereo RCA inputs and outputs, as well as a 1/4" TRS output jack. Its incredible low-noise operation delivers sound exactly as it's read from your records by the turntable's needle. We've also included a 12 V adapter to power this awesome audio solution.

DO WONDERS FOR YOUR WAX
Vinyl is making a huge comeback, and it's time to get your wheels spinning. Plug your turntable into the PP400, send a line out to a mixer or the AUX inputs on your home stereo, and take a spin on the freeway of retro-cool. For about the price of a couple of prerecorded CDs you can experience the high-fidelity sound of real vinyl, the medium that launched the rock and roll revolution.



AMAZON.COM
In the age of the MP3, it can be easy to forget that a turntable signal needs a little help before it reaches a mixer or home stereo if it's going to be heard. Thanks to the PP400 phono preamp, your turntable will get the boost it needs to bring your vinyl to life.

Converts your phono signal to a line level signal.
Click to enlarge. 

BRING YOUR VINYL TO LIFE.
Viva Vinyl
The ultra-compact PP400 features stereo RCA inputs and outputs, as well as a 1/4-inch TRS output jack. Its incredible low-noise operation delivers sound exactly as it's read from your records by the turntable's needle, at line level, so devices lacking in the phono input department will work just fine. Behringer also includes a 12 V adapter to power this awesome audio solution. 

Do Wonders For Your Wax
Vinyl is making a huge comeback, and it's time to get your wheels spinning. Plug your turntable into the PP400, send a line out to a mixer or the AUX inputs on your home stereo, and take a spin on the freeway of retro-cool. For about the price of a couple of prerecorded CDs you can experience the high-fidelity sound of real vinyl, the medium that launched the rock and roll revolution. 

What's in the Box
Behringer PP400 Ultra-Compact Phono Preamp, AC Adapter, User's Manual
